page.title: 08The Diving Centre(continued)
page.content:
Numerous rare animals and plants occur in Lundy waters-many of them Mediterranean/Atlantic species.The island represents the northernmost limit of some species and the most southerly of others.Lundy has been a voluntary marine reserve since 1973. The Diving Centre has its own beach with restroom,workshop and compressor site.Aqualung cylinders and weight belts are provided,and there is storage for personal diving gear. There is a hardboat to reach the diving sites and there are inflatables for hire,as well as other watersport equipment. {John Shaw.}
For further information contact: {John or Shaunne Shaw, Aquaserve {Diving Ltd, 221 Percy Road, Whitton, {Middlesex.TW2 6JL. 01.894 4023}(Divers should be minimum 3rd.class BSAC).
